channel.title: t3hsite
channel.description: This is project to make a reliable, maintainable and most importantly user-friendly theme for Jekyll from scratch, while learning good HTML5 and SASS/CSS.

item.title: Part 5: Guide to the Complete Theme
item.description: I completed the theme, documenting as I went along, this post details the features and how to use them.

item.title: Part 3: Laying a CSS and SASS Foundation from Scratch
item.description: Removing the default CSS for a Jekyll site and laying a nice SASS foundation for building on.

item.title: Part 4: Clean Basic HTML
item.description: Stripping out the basic HTML and starting with a clean and well understood structure.

item.title: Part 2: Tooling Up
item.description: Install Ruby, Jekyll and Rouge and a quick primer on what Jekyll gives you.

item.title: Part 1: A Fresh Jekyll Site
item.description: This is documentation of my attempt to make a Jekyll blog-site from scratch, deleting most of the default cruft, justifying every single line for maximum understanding. Learning good HTML5 and CSS along the way.

item.title: Test Post
item.description: Test post to see how various mardown formatting options appear.
